t.013: I’m Louan Ourvouai, a Unity gameplay engineer and ENSIIE (Paris–Évry) graduate, an engineering school specialized in computer science and mathematics, with a Graduate Engineer degree, JIN track (Video Games and Digital Interactions). I’ve built Unity projects across mobile, VR, Windows, and macOS, covering genres such as RTS, FPS/TPS, idle, 2D platformers, and serious games. I previously led the development of a mobile RTS, and I’m currently leading a pet-care mobile game project. Beyond programming, I enjoy contributing across the whole creation pipeline—visuals, sound, narrative, and game design—to help craft cohesive player experiences.
t.015: I turn ideas into playable prototypes and production-ready gameplay systems in Unity, focusing on game feel, clear communication, and clean architecture.
t.028: I’m working toward a simple long-term vision: building a stable career as a remote Gameplay Developer, with a routine that helps me stay focused, consistent, and productive over the long run. Remote work matters to me because it supports a healthier pace, long-term sustainability, and smooth collaboration with a team through clear communication, good documentation, and reliable delivery.
t.030: Built through professional experiences, formations, game jams, association projects, and personal game projects.
